intro: Cyclostemon madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar cyclostemon, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow with orange centers, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
